Ask for.example: He asked for a cup of coffee.

Back up.example: She backed up her friend during the argument.

Blow up.example: The bomb blew up in the middle of the street.

Break down.example: My car broke down on the way home.

Break up.example: They decided to break up after five years together.

Bring about.example: The new policy brought about significant changes.

Bring in.example: They brought in a new manager to improve the team.

Bring up.example: She brought up an interesting point in the meeting.

Call off.example: The meeting was called off due to bad weather.

Call up.example: I'll call him up to confirm the meeting.

Carry on.example: Despite the challenges, he carried on with his project.

Catch up.example: She worked hard to catch up with the rest of the team.

Check out.example: We need to check out of the hotel by noon.

Come across.example: I came across my old photos while cleaning.

Come back.example: She came back from vacation yesterday.

Come out.example: Her new book comes out next month.

Come up with.example: We need to come up with a new plan.

Cut back.example: We need to cut back on spending.

Cut down.example: He needs to cut down on sugar.

Cut off.example: The phone call was cut off suddenly.

Deal with.example: She deals with customer complaints every day.

Do without.example: I can't do without my morning coffee.

Dress up.example: You don't need to dress up for the party.

Drop by.example: I'll drop by your house later.

Drop off.example: Can you drop me off at the station?

End up.example: He ended up going to the party alone.

Figure out.example: I can't figure out how to fix this.

Fill out.example: Please fill out this application form.

Find out.example: I found out she was moving away.

Get away.example: We need to get away for the weekend.

Get back.example: I'll get back to you on that.

Get by.example: We can get by with what we have.

Get in.example: What time does your flight get in?

Get off.example: I get off work at 5 PM.

Get on.example: We need to get on the bus now.

Get over.example: It took her a long time to get over the flu.

Get through.example: I finally got through the exam.

Give away.example: She gave away all her old clothes.

Give in.example: He gave in to the pressure.

Give up.example: Don't give up on your dreams.

Go ahead.example: Go ahead and start without me.

Go back.example: I have to go back to the office.

Go down.example: Prices are going down this week.

Go over.example: Let's go over the details again.

Go through.example: She went through a tough time.

Grow up.example: He grew up in a small town.

Hang out.example: We like to hang out at the mall.

Hang up.example: She hung up before I could explain.

Hold on.example: Hold on a second, I'll be right back.

Hold up.example: Sorry I'm late; I was held up in traffic.

Let down.example: I hope I don't let you down.

Let in.example: Don't let anyone in without checking.

Let out.example: She let out a loud scream.

Look after.example: She looks after her elderly parents.

Look ahead.example: Let's look ahead to next year.

Look around.example: We looked around the city for hours.

Look forward to.example: I'm looking forward to the weekend.

Look into.example: The police are looking into the matter.

Look out.example: Look out for cars when crossing.

Look over.example: Please look over the report before signing.

Look up.example: Look up the word in the dictionary.

Make out.example: I can't make out what he's saying.

Make up.example: They made up after their argument.

Make up for.example: I'll make up for the lost time.

Move on.example: Let's move on to the next topic.

Pass away.example: His grandfather passed away last night.

Pass out.example: She passed out from the heat.

Pick up.example: Can you pick up some groceries?

Pick out.example: She picked out a dress for the party.

Pick up on.example: He picked up on her subtle hints.

Point out.example: She pointed out the error in the report.

Put away.example: Put away your toys when you're done.

Put off.example: We had to put off the meeting.

Put on.example: She put on her jacket before leaving.

Put up with.example: I can't put up with his behavior.

Run into.example: I ran into an old friend at the store.

Set up.example: They set up the equipment for the event.

Show up.example: He didn't show up for the interview.

Shut down.example: The factory shut down last year.

Stand by.example: I'll stand by you no matter what.

Stand out.example: Her red dress made her stand out.

Stand up.example: Please stand up for the national anthem.

Take apart.example: He took apart the clock to fix it.

Take off.example: The plane took off on time.

Take over.example: He took over the company after the merger.

Take up.example: She took up painting as a hobby.

Tear down.example: They tore down the old building.

Think over.example: Think over my suggestion before deciding.

Throw up.example: He threw up after the roller coaster ride.

Turn around.example: Turn around and go back the way you came.

Turn down.example: She turned down the job offer.

Turn off.example: Please turn off the lights when you leave.

Turn on.example: Turn on the TV to watch the game.

Turn in.example: Turn in your assignments by Friday.

Turn out.example: It turned out to be a great day.

Turn over.example: Turn over the page to continue reading.

Turn up.example: Turn up the volume, I can't hear.

Work out.example: I work out at the gym every morning. / Everything worked out in the end.
